name: 哥林多前书
description: 保罗写给哥林多教会的信，处理教会内部问题和属灵恩赐

verses.zh: 奉神旨意，蒙召作耶稣基督使徒的保罗，同兄弟所提尼，
verses.en: Paul, called to be an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and our brother Sosthenes,

verses.zh: 写信给在哥林多神的教会，就是在基督耶稣里成圣、蒙召作圣徒的，以及所有在各处求告我主耶稣基督之名的人。基督是他们的主，也是我们的主。
verses.en: To the church of God in Corinth, to those sanctified in Christ Jesus and called to be his holy people, together with all those everywhere who call on the name of our Lord Jesus Christ—their Lord and ours:

verses.zh: 愿恩惠、平安从神我们的父和主耶稣基督归与你们！
verses.en: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.zh: 我常为你们感谢我的神，因神在基督耶稣里所赐给你们的恩惠；
verses.en: I always thank my God for you because of his grace given you in Christ Jesus.

verses.zh: 又因你们在他里面凡事富足，口才、知识都全备，
verses.en: For in him you have been enriched in every way—with all kinds of speech and with all knowledge—

verses.zh: 正如我为基督作的见证，在你们心里得以坚固，
verses.en: God thus confirming our testimony about Christ among you.

verses.zh: 以致你们在恩赐上没有一样不及人的，等候我们的主耶稣基督显现。
verses.en: Therefore you do not lack any spiritual gift as you eagerly wait for our Lord Jesus Christ to be revealed.

verses.zh: 他也必坚固你们到底，叫你们在我们主耶稣基督的日子无可责备。
verses.en: He will also keep you firm to the end, so that you will be blameless on the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.zh: 神是信实的，你们原是被他所召，好与他儿子我们主耶稣基督一同得分。
verses.en: God is faithful, who has called you into fellowship with his Son, Jesus Christ our Lord.

verses.zh: 弟兄们，我藉我们主耶稣基督的名劝你们都说一样的话。你们中间也不可分党，只要一心一意，彼此相合。
verses.en: I appeal to you, brothers and sisters, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that all of you agree with one another in what you say and that there be no divisions among you, but that you be perfectly united in mind and thought.

verses.zh: 因为革来氏家里的人曾对我提起弟兄们，说你们中间有分争。
verses.en: My brothers and sisters, some from Chloe’s household have informed me that there are quarrels among you.

verses.zh: 我的意思就是你们各人说：我是属保罗的；我是属亚波罗的；我是属矶法的；我是属基督的。
verses.en: What I mean is this: One of you says, I follow Paul; another, I follow Apollos; another, I follow Cephas; still another, I follow Christ.

verses.zh: 基督是分开的吗？保罗为你们钉了十字架吗？你们是奉保罗的名受了洗吗？
verses.en: Is Christ divided? Was Paul crucified for you? Were you baptized in the name of Paul?

verses.zh: 我感谢神，除了基利司布并该犹以外，我没有给你们一个人施洗。
verses.en: I thank God that I did not baptize any of you except Crispus and Gaius,

verses.zh: 免得有人说，你们是奉我的名受洗。
verses.en: so no one can say that you were baptized in my name.

verses.zh: (我也给司提反家施过洗。此外给别人施洗没有，我却记不清了。)
verses.en: (Yes, I also baptized the household of Stephanas; beyond that, I don’t remember if I baptized anyone else.)

verses.zh: 基督差遣我，原不是为施洗，乃是为传福音；并不用智慧的言语，免得基督的十字架落了空。
verses.en: For Christ did not send me to baptize, but to preach the gospel—not with wisdom and eloquence, lest the cross of Christ be emptied of its power.

verses.zh: 因为十字架的道理，在那灭亡的人为愚拙；在我们得救的人，却为神的大能。
verses.en: For the message of the cross is foolishness to those who are perishing, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God.

verses.zh: 就如经上所记：我要灭绝智慧人的智慧，废弃聪明人的聪明。
verses.en: For it is written: I will destroy the wisdom of the wise; the intelligence of the intelligent I will frustrate.

verses.zh: 智慧人在哪里？文士在哪里？这世上的辩士在哪里？神岂不是叫这世上的智慧变成愚拙吗？
verses.en: Where is the wise person? Where is the teacher of the law? Where is the philosopher of this age? Has not God made foolish the wisdom of the world?

verses.zh: 世人凭自己的智慧，既不认识神，神就乐意用人所当作愚拙的道理，拯救那些信的人；这就是神的智慧了。
verses.en: For since in the wisdom of God the world through its wisdom did not know him, God was pleased through the foolishness of what was preached to save those who believe.

verses.zh: 犹太人是要神迹，希利尼人是求智慧，
verses.en: Jews demand signs and Greeks look for wisdom,

verses.zh: 我们却是传钉十字架的基督，在犹太人为绊脚石，在外邦人为愚拙；
verses.en: but we preach Christ crucified: a stumbling block to Jews and foolishness to Gentiles,

verses.zh: 但在那蒙召的，无论是犹太人、希利尼人，基督总为神的能力，神的智慧。
verses.en: but to those whom God has called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God and the wisdom of God.

verses.zh: 因神的愚拙总比人智慧，神的软弱总比人强壮。
verses.en: For the foolishness of God is wiser than human wisdom, and the weakness of God is stronger than human strength.

verses.zh: 弟兄们哪，可见你们蒙召的，按着肉体有智慧的不多，有能力的不多，有尊贵的也不多。
verses.en: Brothers and sisters, think of what you were when you were called. Not many of you were wise by human standards; not many were influential; not many were of noble birth.

verses.zh: 神却拣选了世上愚拙的，叫有智慧的羞愧；又拣选了世上软弱的，叫那强壮的羞愧。
verses.en: But God chose the foolish things of the world to shame the wise; God chose the weak things of the world to shame the strong.

verses.zh: 神也拣选了世上卑贱的，被人厌恶的，以及那无有的，为要废掉那有的，
verses.en: God chose the lowly things of this world and the despised things—and the things that are not—to nullify the things that are,

verses.zh: 使一切有血气的，在神面前一个也不能自夸。
verses.en: so that no one may boast before him.

verses.zh: 但你们得在基督耶稣里，是本乎神，神又使他成为我们的智慧、公义、圣洁、救赎。
verses.en: It is because of him that you are in Christ Jesus, who has become for us wisdom from God—that is, our righteousness, holiness and redemption.

verses.zh: 如经上所记：夸口的，当指着主夸口。
verses.en: Therefore, as it is written: Let the one who boasts boast in the Lord.

verses.zh: 弟兄们，从前我到你们那里去，并没有用高言大智对你们宣传神的奥秘。
verses.en: And so it was with me, brothers and sisters. When I came to you, I did not come with eloquence or human wisdom as I proclaimed to you the testimony about God.

verses.zh: 因为我曾定了主意，在你们中间不知道别的，只知道耶稣基督并他钉十字架。
verses.en: For I resolved to know nothing while I was with you except Jesus Christ and him crucified.

verses.zh: 我在你们那里，又软弱，又惧怕，又甚战兢。
verses.en: I came to you in weakness with great fear and trembling.

verses.zh: 我说的话、讲的道，不是用智慧委婉的言语，乃是用圣灵和大能的明证。
verses.en: My message and my preaching were not with wise and persuasive words, but with a demonstration of the Spirit’s power,

verses.zh: 叫你们的信不在乎人的智慧，只在乎神的大能。
verses.en: so that your faith might not rest on human wisdom, but on God’s power.

verses.zh: 然而，在完全的人中，我们也讲智慧。但不是这世上的智慧，也不是这世上有权有位将要败亡之人的智慧。
verses.en: We do, however, speak a message of wisdom among the mature, but not the wisdom of this age or of the rulers of this age, who are coming to nothing.

verses.zh: 我们讲的，乃是从前所隐藏、神奥秘的智慧，就是神在万世以前预定使我们得荣耀的。
verses.en: No, we declare God’s wisdom, a mystery that has been hidden and that God destined for our glory before time began.

verses.zh: 这智慧，世上有权有位的人没有一个知道的；他们若知道，就不把荣耀的主钉在十字架上了。
verses.en: None of the rulers of this age understood it, for if they had, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory.

verses.zh: 如经上所记：神为爱他的人所预备的，是眼睛未曾看见，耳朵未曾听见，人心也未曾想到的。
verses.en: However, as it is written: What no eye has seen, what no ear has heard, and what no human mind has conceived—the things God has prepared for those who love him—

verses.zh: 只有神藉着圣灵向我们显明了，因为圣灵参透万事，就是神深奥的事也参透了。
verses.en: these are the things God has revealed to us by his Spirit. The Spirit searches all things, even the deep things of God.

verses.zh: 除了在人里头的灵，谁知道人的事？像这样，除了神的灵，也没有人知道神的事。
verses.en: For who knows a person’s thoughts except their own spirit within them? In the same way no one knows the thoughts of God except the Spirit of God.

verses.zh: 我们所领受的，并不是世上的灵，乃是从神来的灵，叫我们能知道神开恩赐给我们的事。
verses.en: What we have received is not the spirit of the world, but the Spirit who is from God, so that we may understand what God has freely given us.

verses.zh: 并且我们讲说这些事，不是用人智慧所指教的言语，乃是用圣灵所指教的言语，将属灵的话解释属灵的事。
verses.en: This is what we speak, not in words taught us by human wisdom but in words taught by the Spirit, explaining spiritual realities with Spirit-taught words.

verses.zh: 然而，属血气的人不领会神圣灵的事，反倒以为愚拙，并且不能知道，因为这些事惟有属灵的人才能看透。
verses.en: The person without the Spirit does not accept the things that come from the Spirit of God but considers them foolishness, and cannot understand them because they are discerned only through the Spirit.

verses.zh: 属灵的人能看透万事，却没有一人能看透了他。
verses.en: The person with the Spirit makes judgments about all things, but such a person is not subject to merely human judgments,

verses.zh: 谁曾知道主的心去教导他呢？但我们是有基督的心了。
verses.en: for, Who has known the mind of the Lord so as to instruct him? But we have the mind of Christ.

verses.zh: 弟兄们，我从前对你们说话，不能把你们当作属灵的，只得把你们当作属肉体，在基督里为婴孩的。
verses.en: Brothers and sisters, I could not address you as people who live by the Spirit but as people who are still worldly—mere infants in Christ.

verses.zh: 我是用奶喂你们，没有用饭喂你们。那时你们不能吃，就是如今还是不能。
verses.en: I gave you milk, not solid food, for you were not yet ready for it. Indeed, you are still not ready.

verses.zh: 你们仍是属肉体的，因为在你们中间有嫉妒、分争，这岂不是属乎肉体、照着世人的样子行吗？
verses.en: You are still worldly. For since there is jealousy and quarreling among you, are you not worldly? Are you not acting like mere humans?

verses.zh: 有说我是属保罗的，有说我是属亚波罗的，这岂不是你们和世人一样吗？
verses.en: For when one says, I follow Paul, and another, I follow Apollos, are you not mere human beings?

verses.zh: 亚波罗算甚么？保罗算甚么？无非是执事，照主所赐给他们各人的，引导你们相信。
verses.en: What, after all, is Apollos? And what is Paul? Only servants, through whom you came to believe—as the Lord has assigned to each his task.

verses.zh: 我栽种了，亚波罗浇灌了，惟有神叫他生长。
verses.en: I planted the seed, Apollos watered it, but God has been making it grow.

verses.zh: 可见栽种的，算不得甚么，浇灌的，也算不得甚么；只在那叫他生长的神。
verses.en: So neither the one who plants nor the one who waters is anything, but only God, who makes things grow.

verses.zh: 栽种的和浇灌的都是一样，但将来各人要照自己的工夫得自己的赏赐。
verses.en: The one who plants and the one who waters have one purpose, and they will each be rewarded according to their own labor.

verses.zh: 因为我们是与神同工的；你们是神所耕种的田地，所建造的房屋。
verses.en: For we are co-workers in God’s service; you are God’s field, God’s building.

verses.zh: 我照神所给我的恩，好像一个聪明的工头，立好了根基，有别人在上面建造；只是各人要谨慎怎样在上面建造。
verses.en: By the grace God has given me, I laid a foundation as a wise builder, and someone else is building on it. But each one should build with care.

verses.zh: 因为那已经立好的根基就是耶稣基督，此外没有人能立别的根基。
verses.en: For no one can lay any foundation other than the one already laid, which is Jesus Christ.

verses.zh: 若有人用金、银、宝石、草木、禾秸在这根基上建造，
verses.en: If anyone builds on this foundation using gold, silver, costly stones, wood, hay or straw,

verses.zh: 各人的工程必然显露，因为那日子要将它表明出来，有火发现，这火要试验各人的工程怎样。
verses.en: their work will be shown for what it is, because the Day will bring it to light. It will be revealed with fire, and the fire will test the quality of each person’s work.

verses.zh: 人在那根基上所建造的工程若存得住，他就要得赏赐。
verses.en: If what has been built survives, the builder will receive a reward.

verses.zh: 人的工程若被烧了，他就要受亏损，自己却要得救；虽然得救，乃像从火里经过的一样。
verses.en: If it is burned up, the builder will suffer loss but yet will be saved—even though only as one escaping through the flames.

verses.zh: 岂不知你们是神的殿，神的灵住在你们里头吗？
verses.en: Don’t you know that you yourselves are God’s temple and that God’s Spirit dwells in your midst?

verses.zh: 若有人毁坏神的殿，神必要毁坏那人；因为神的殿是圣的，这殿就是你们。
verses.en: If anyone destroys God’s temple, God will destroy that person; for God’s temple is sacred, and you together are that temple.

verses.zh: 人不可自欺。你们中间若有人在这世界自以为有智慧，倒不如变作愚拙，好成为有智慧的。
verses.en: Do not deceive yourselves. If any of you think you are wise by the standards of this age, you should become fools so that you may become wise.

verses.zh: 因这世界的智慧，在神看是愚拙。如经上记着说：主叫有智慧的，中了自己的诡计。
verses.en: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness in God’s sight. As it is written: He catches the wise in their craftiness;

verses.zh: 又说：主知道智慧人的意念是虚妄的。
verses.en: and again, The Lord knows that the thoughts of the wise are futile.

verses.zh: 所以无论谁，都不可拿人夸口，因为万有全是你们的。
verses.en: So then, no more boasting about human leaders! All things are yours,

verses.zh: 或保罗，或亚波罗，或矶法，或世界，或生，或死，或现在的事，或将来的事，全是你们的。
verses.en: whether Paul or Apollos or Cephas or the world or life or death or the present or the future—all are yours,

verses.zh: 并且你们是属基督的，基督又是属神的。
verses.en: and you are of Christ, and Christ is of God.

verses.zh: 人应当以我们为基督的执事，为神奥秘事的管家。
verses.en: This, then, is how you ought to regard us: as servants of Christ and as those entrusted with the mysteries God has revealed.

verses.zh: 所求于管家的，是要他有忠心。
verses.en: Now it is required that those who have been given a trust must prove faithful.

verses.zh: 我被你们论断，或被别人论断，我都以为极小的事；连我自己也不论断自己。
verses.en: I care very little if I am judged by you or by any human court; indeed, I do not even judge myself.

verses.zh: 我虽不觉得自己有错，却也不能因此得以称义；但判断我的乃是主。
verses.en: My conscience is clear, but that does not make me innocent. It is the Lord who judges me.

verses.zh: 所以，时候未到，什么都不要论断，只等主来，他要照出暗中的隐情，显明人心的意念。那时，各人要从神那里得着称赞。
verses.en: Therefore judge nothing before the appointed time; wait until the Lord comes. He will bring to light what is hidden in darkness and will expose the motives of the heart. At that time each will receive their praise from God.

verses.zh: 弟兄们，我为你们的缘故，拿这些事转比自己和亚波罗，叫你们效法我们不可过于圣经所记，免得你们自高自大，贵重这个，轻看那个。
verses.en: Now, brothers and sisters, I have applied these things to myself and Apollos for your benefit, so that you may learn from us the meaning of the saying, Do not go beyond what is written. Then you will not be puffed up in being a follower of one of us over against the other.

verses.zh: 使你与人不同的是谁呢？你有甚么不是领受的呢？若是领受的，为何自夸，仿佛不是领受的呢？
verses.en: For who makes you different from anyone else? What do you have that you did not receive? And if you did receive it, why do you boast as though you did not?

verses.zh: 你们已经饱足了，已经丰富了，不用我们，自己就作王了。我愿意你们果真作王，好叫我们也与你们一同作王。
verses.en: Already you have all you want! Already you have become rich! You have begun to reign—and that without us! How I wish that you really had begun to reign so that we also might reign with you!

verses.zh: 我想神把我们使徒明明列在末后，好像定死罪的囚犯；因为我们成了一台戏，给世人和天使观看。
verses.en: For it seems to me that God has put us apostles on display at the end of the procession, like those condemned to die in the arena. We have been made a spectacle to the whole universe, to angels as well as to human beings.

verses.zh: 我们为基督的缘故算是愚拙的，你们在基督里倒是聪明的；我们软弱，你们倒强壮；你们有荣耀，我们倒被藐视。
verses.en: We are fools for Christ, but you are so wise in Christ! We are weak, but you are strong! You are honored, we are dishonored!

verses.zh: 直到如今，我们还是又饥又渴，又赤身露体，又挨打，又没有一定的住处，
verses.en: To this very hour we go hungry and thirsty, we are in rags, we are brutally treated, we are homeless.

verses.zh: 并且劳苦，亲手作工。被人咒骂，我们就祝福；被人逼迫，我们就忍受；
verses.en: We work hard with our own hands. When we are cursed, we bless; when we are persecuted, we endure it;

verses.zh: 被人毁谤，我们就善劝。直到如今，人还把我们看作世界上的污秽，万物中的渣滓。
verses.en: when we are slandered, we answer kindly. We have become the scum of the earth, the garbage of the world—right up to this moment.

verses.zh: 我写这话，不是叫你们羞愧，乃是警戒你们，好像我所亲爱的儿女一样。
verses.en: I am writing this not to shame you but to warn you as my dear children.

verses.zh: 你们学基督的，师傅虽有一万，为父的却是不多，因我在基督耶稣里用福音生了你们。
verses.en: Even if you had ten thousand guardians in Christ, you do not have many fathers, for in Christ Jesus I became your father through the gospel.

verses.zh: 所以，我求你们效法我。
verses.en: Therefore I urge you to imitate me.

verses.zh: 因此我已打发提摩太到你们那里去。他在主里面，是我所亲爱、忠心的儿子，他必提醒你们，记念我在基督里怎样行事，在各处各教会怎样教导人。
verses.en: For this reason I have sent to you Timothy, my son whom I love, who is faithful in the Lord. He will remind you of my way of life in Christ Jesus, which agrees with what I teach everywhere in every church.

verses.zh: 有些人自高自大，以为我不到你们那里去。
verses.en: Some of you have become arrogant, as if I were not coming to you.

verses.zh: 然而，主若许我，我必快到你们那里去，并且我所要知道的，不是那些自高自大之人的言语，乃是他们的权能。
verses.en: But I will come to you very soon, if the Lord is willing, and then I will find out not only how these arrogant people are talking, but what power they have.

verses.zh: 因为神的国不在乎言语，乃在乎权能。
verses.en: For the kingdom of God is not a matter of talk but of power.

verses.zh: 你们愿意怎么样呢？是愿意我带着刑杖到你们那里去呢？还是要我存慈爱温柔的心呢？
verses.en: What do you prefer? Shall I come to you with a rod of discipline, or shall I come in love and with a gentle spirit?

verses.zh: 风闻在你们中间有淫乱的事。这样的淫乱连外邦人中也没有，就是有人收了他的继母。
verses.en: It is actually reported that there is sexual immorality among you, and of a kind that even pagans do not tolerate: A man is sleeping with his father’s wife.

verses.zh: 你们还是自高自大，并没有哀痛，把行这事的人从你们中间赶出去。
verses.en: And you are proud! Shouldn’t you rather have gone into mourning and have put out of your fellowship the man who has been doing this?

verses.zh: 我身子虽不在你们那里，心却在你们那里，好像我亲自在那里，已经判断了行这事的人。
verses.en: For my part, even though I am not physically present, I am with you in spirit. As one who is present with you in this way, I have already passed judgment in the name of our Lord Jesus on the one who has been doing this.

verses.zh: 就是你们聚会的时候，我的心也同在，奉我们主耶稣的名，并用我们主耶稣的权能，
verses.en: So when you are assembled and I am with you in spirit, and the power of our Lord Jesus is present,

verses.zh: 要把这样的人交给撒但，败坏他的肉体，使他的灵魂在主耶稣的日子可以得救。
verses.en: hand this man over to Satan for the destruction of the flesh, so that his spirit may be saved on the day of the Lord.

verses.zh: 你们这自夸是不好的。岂不知一点面酵能使全团发起来吗？
verses.en: Your boasting is not good. Don’t you know that a little yeast leavens the whole batch of dough?

verses.zh: 你们既是无酵的面，应当把旧酵除净，好使你们成为新团；因为我们逾越节的羔羊基督，已经被杀献祭了。
verses.en: Get rid of the old yeast, so that you may be a new unleavened batch—as you really are. For Christ, our Passover lamb, has been sacrificed.

verses.zh: 所以，我们守这节不可用旧酵，也不可用恶毒、邪恶的酵，只用诚实真正的无酵饼。
verses.en: Therefore let us keep the Festival, not with the old bread leavened with malice and wickedness, but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.

verses.zh: 我在前封信上曾写给你们说，不可与淫乱的人相交。
verses.en: I wrote to you in my letter not to associate with sexually immoral people—

verses.zh: 此话不是指这世上一概行淫乱的，或贪婪的、勒索的，或拜偶像的；若是这样，你们除非离开世界方可。
verses.en: not at all meaning the people of this world who are immoral, or the greedy and swindlers, or idolaters. In that case you would have to leave this world.

verses.zh: 但如今我写给你们说，若有称为弟兄，是行淫乱的，或贪婪的，或拜偶像的，或辱骂的，或醉酒的，或勒索的，这样的人不可与他相交，就是与他吃饭都不可。
verses.en: But now I am writing to you that you must not associate with anyone who claims to be a brother or sister but is sexually immoral or greedy, an idolater or slanderer, a drunkard or swindler. Do not even eat with such people.

verses.zh: 因为审判教外的人与我何干？教内的人岂不是你们审判的吗？
verses.en: What business is it of mine to judge those outside the church? Are you not to judge those inside?

verses.zh: 至于外人，有神审判他们。你们应当把那恶人从你们中间赶出去。
verses.en: God will judge those outside. Expel the wicked person from among you.

verses.zh: 你们中间有彼此相争的事，怎敢在不义的人面前求审，不在圣徒面前求审呢？
verses.en: If any of you has a dispute with another, do you dare to take it before the ungodly for judgment instead of before the Lord’s people?

verses.zh: 岂不知圣徒要审判世界吗？若世界为你们所审，难道你们不配审判这最小的事吗？
verses.en: Or don’t you know that the Lord’s people will judge the world? And if you are to judge the world, are you not competent to judge trivial cases?

verses.zh: 岂不知我们要审判天使吗？何况今生的事呢？
verses.en: Do not you know that we will judge angels? How much more the things of this life!

verses.zh: 既是这样，你们若有今生的事当审判，是派教会所轻看的人审判吗？
verses.en: Therefore, if you have disputes about such matters, do you ask for a ruling from those whose way of life is scorned in the church?

verses.zh: 我说这话是要叫你们羞愧。难道你们中间没有一个智慧人，能审断弟兄们的事吗？
verses.en: I say this to shame you. Is it possible that there is nobody among you wise enough to judge a dispute between believers?

verses.zh: 你们竟是弟兄与弟兄告状，而且告在不信主的人面前。
verses.en: But instead, one brother takes another to court—and this in front of unbelievers!

verses.zh: 你们彼此告状，这已经是你们的大错了。为什么不情愿受欺呢？为什么不情愿吃亏呢？
verses.en: The very fact that you have lawsuits among you means you have been completely defeated already. Why not rather be wronged? Why not rather be cheated?

verses.zh: 你们倒是欺压人、亏负人，况且所欺压所亏负的就是弟兄。
verses.en: Instead, you yourselves cheat and do wrong, and you do this to your brothers and sisters.

verses.zh: 岂不知不义的人不能承受神的国吗？不要自欺！无论是淫乱的、拜偶像的、奸淫的、作娈童的、亲男色的、
verses.en: Or do you not know that wrongdoers will not inherit the kingdom of God? Do not be deceived: Neither the sexually immoral nor idolaters nor adulterers nor men who have sex with men

verses.zh: 偷窃的、贪婪的、醉酒的、辱骂的、勒索的，都不能承受神的国。
verses.en: nor thieves nor the greedy nor drunkards nor slanderers nor swindlers will inherit the kingdom of God.

verses.zh: 你们中间也有人从前是这样；但如今你们奉主耶稣基督的名，并藉着我们神的灵，已经洗净、成圣、称义了。
verses.en: And that is what some of you were. But you were washed, you were sanctified, you were justified in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ and by the Spirit of our God.

verses.zh: 凡事我都可行，但不都有益处。凡事我都可行，但无论哪一件，我总不受它的辖制。
verses.en: I have the right to do anything, you say—but not everything is beneficial. I have the right to do anything—but I will not be mastered by anything.

verses.zh: 食物是为肚腹，肚腹是为食物；但神要废掉这两样。身子不是为淫乱，乃是为主；主也是为身子。
verses.en: You say, Food for the stomach and the stomach for food, and God will destroy them both. The body, however, is not meant for sexual immorality but for the Lord, and the Lord for the body.

verses.zh: 神已经叫主复活，也要用自己的能力叫我们复活。
verses.en: By his power God raised the Lord from the dead, and he will raise us also.

verses.zh: 岂不知你们的身子是基督的肢体吗？我可以将基督的肢体作为娼妓的肢体吗？断乎不可！
verses.en: Do you not know that your bodies are members of Christ himself? Shall I then take the members of Christ and unite them with a prostitute? Never!

verses.zh: 岂不知与娼妓联合的，便是与她成为一体吗？因为主说：二人要成为一体。
verses.en: Do you not know that he who unites himself with a prostitute is one with her in body? For it is said, The two will become one flesh.

verses.zh: 但与主联合的，便是与主成为一灵。
verses.en: But whoever is united with the Lord is one with him in spirit.

verses.zh: 你们要逃避淫乱的事。人所犯的，无论甚么罪，都在身子以外，惟有行淫乱的，是得罪自己的身子。
verses.en: Flee from sexual immorality. All other sins a person commits are outside the body, but whoever sins sexually, sins against their own body.

verses.zh: 岂不知你们的身子就是圣灵的殿吗？这圣灵是从神而来，住在你们里头的；并且你们不是自己的人，
verses.en: Do you not know that your bodies are temples of the Holy Spirit, who is in you, whom you have received from God? You are not your own;

verses.zh: 因为你们是重价买来的。所以，要在你们的身子上荣耀神。
verses.en: you were bought at a price. Therefore honor God with your bodies.

verses.zh: 论到你们信上所提的事，我说男不近女倒好。
verses.en: Now for the matters you wrote about: It is good for a man not to have sexual relations with a woman.

verses.zh: 但要免淫乱的事，男子当各有自己的妻子，女子也当各有自己的丈夫。
verses.en: But since sexual immorality is occurring, each man should have sexual relations with his own wife, and each woman with her own husband.

verses.zh: 丈夫当用合宜之分待妻子，妻子待丈夫也要如此。
verses.en: The husband should fulfill his marital duty to his wife, and likewise the wife to her husband.

verses.zh: 妻子没有权柄主张自己的身子，乃在丈夫；丈夫也没有权柄主张自己的身子，乃在妻子。
verses.en: The wife does not have authority over her own body but yields it to her husband. In the same way, the husband does not have authority over his own body but yields it to his wife.

verses.zh: 夫妻不可彼此亏负，除非两相情愿，暂时分房，为要专心祷告方可；以后仍要同房，免得撒但趁着你们情不自禁引诱你们。
verses.en: Do not deprive each other except perhaps by mutual consent and for a time, so that you may devote yourselves to prayer. Then come together again so that Satan will not tempt you because of your lack of self-control.

verses.zh: 我说这话，原是准你们的，不是命你们的。
verses.en: I say this as a concession, not as a command.

verses.zh: 我愿意众人像我一样；只是各人领受神的恩赐，一个是这样，一个是那样。
verses.en: I wish that all of you were as I am. But each of you has your own gift from God; one has this gift, another has that.

verses.zh: 我对着没有嫁娶的和寡妇说，若他们常像我就好。
verses.en: Now to the unmarried and the widows I say: It is good for them to stay unmarried, as I do.

verses.zh: 倘若自己禁止不住，就可以嫁娶。与其欲火攻心，倒不如嫁娶为妙。
verses.en: But if they cannot control themselves, they should marry, for it is better to marry than to burn with lust.

verses.zh: 至于那已经嫁娶的，我吩咐他们；其实不是我吩咐，乃是主吩咐说：妻子不可离开丈夫，
verses.en: To the married I give this command (not I, but the Lord): A wife must not separate from her husband.

verses.zh: 若是离开了，不可再嫁，或是仍同丈夫和好。丈夫也不可离弃妻子。
verses.en: But if she does separate, she must remain unmarried or else be reconciled to her husband. And a husband must not divorce his wife.

verses.zh: 我对其余的人说，不是主说，乃是我说：若有弟兄有不信的妻子，妻子也情愿和他同住，他就不要离弃妻子。
verses.en: To the rest I say this (I, not the Lord): If any brother has a wife who is not a believer and she is willing to live with him, he must not divorce her.

verses.zh: 妻子有不信的丈夫，丈夫也情愿和她同住，她就不要离弃丈夫。
verses.en: And if a woman has a husband who is not a believer and he is willing to live with her, she must not divorce him.

verses.zh: 因为不信的丈夫就因着妻子成了圣洁，并且不信的妻子就因着丈夫成了圣洁；不然，你们的儿女就不洁净，但如今他们是圣洁的了。
verses.en: For the unbelieving husband has been sanctified through his wife, and the unbelieving wife has been sanctified through her believing husband. Otherwise your children would be unclean, but as it is, they are holy.

verses.zh: 倘若那不信的人要离去，就由他离去吧！无论是弟兄，是姐妹，遇着这样的事，都不必拘束。神召我们原是要我们和睦。
verses.en: But if the unbeliever leaves, let it be so. The brother or the sister is not bound in such circumstances; God has called us to live in peace.

verses.zh: 你这作妻子的，怎么知道不能救你的丈夫呢？你这作丈夫的，怎么知道不能救你的妻子呢？
verses.en: How do you know, wife, whether you will save your husband? Or, how do you know, husband, whether you will save your wife?

verses.zh: 只要照主所分给各人的，和神所召各人的而行。我吩咐各教会都是这样。
verses.en: Nevertheless, each person should live as a believer in whatever situation the Lord has assigned to them, just as God has called them. This is the rule I lay down in all the churches.

verses.zh: 有人已受割礼蒙召呢，就不要废割礼；有人未受割礼蒙召呢，就不要受割礼。
verses.en: Was a man already circumcised when he was called? He should not become uncircumcised. Was a man uncircumcised when he was called? He should not be circumcised.

verses.zh: 受割礼算不得甚么，不受割礼也算不得甚么，只要守神的诫命就是了。
verses.en: Circumcision is nothing and uncircumcision is nothing. Keeping God’s commands is what counts.

verses.zh: 各人蒙召的时候是什么身份，仍要守住这身份。
verses.en: Each person should remain in the situation they were in when God called them.

verses.zh: 你是作奴仆蒙召的吗？不要因此忧虑；若能以自由，就求自由更好。
verses.en: Were you a slave when you were called? Don’t let it trouble you—although if you can gain your freedom, do so.

verses.zh: 因为作奴仆蒙召于主的，就是主所释放的人；作自由之人蒙召的，就是基督的奴仆。
verses.en: For the one who was a slave when called to faith in the Lord is the Lord’s freed person; similarly, the one who was free when called is Christ’s slave.

verses.zh: 你们是重价买来的，不要作人的奴仆。
verses.en: You were bought at a price; do not become slaves of human beings.

verses.zh: 弟兄们，你们蒙召的时候是什么身份，仍要在神面前守住这身份。
verses.en: Brothers and sisters, each person, as responsible to God, should remain in the situation they were in when God called them.

verses.zh: 论到童身的人，我没有主的命令，但我既蒙主怜悯能作忠心的人，就把自己的意见告诉你们。
verses.en: Now about virgins: I have no command from the Lord, but I give a judgment as one who by the Lord’s mercy is trustworthy.

verses.zh: 因现今的艰难，据我看来，人不如守素安常才好。
verses.en: Because of the present crisis, I think that it is good for a man to remain as he is.

verses.zh: 你有妻子缠着呢，就不要求脱离；你没有妻子呢，就不要求妻子。
verses.en: Are you pledged to a woman? Do not seek to be released. Are you free from such a commitment? Do not look for a wife.

verses.zh: 你若娶妻，并不是犯罪；处女若出嫁，也不是犯罪。然而这等人肉身必受苦难，我却愿意你们免这苦难。
verses.en: But if you do marry, you have not sinned; and if a betrothed woman marries, she has not sinned. But they will have trouble in this life, and I would spare you this.

verses.zh: 弟兄们，我对你们说，时候减少了。从此以后，那有妻子的，要像没有妻子；
verses.en: What I mean, brothers and sisters, is that the time is short. From now on those who have wives should live as if they do not;

verses.zh: 哀哭的，要像不哀哭；快乐的，要像不快乐；置买的，要像无有所得；
verses.en: those who mourn, as if they did not; those who are happy, as if they were not; those who buy something, as if it never belonged to them;

verses.zh: 用世物的，要像不用世物；因为这世界的样子将要过去了。
verses.en: those who use the things of the world, as if not engrossed in them. For this world in its present form is passing away.

verses.zh: 我愿意你们无所挂虑。没有娶妻的，是为主的事挂虑，想怎样叫主喜悦。
verses.en: I would like you to be free from concern. An unmarried man is concerned about the Lord’s affairs—how he can please the Lord.

verses.zh: 娶了妻的，是为世上的事挂虑，想怎样叫妻子喜悦。
verses.en: But a married man is concerned about the affairs of this world—how he can please his wife—

verses.zh: 妇人和处女也有分别。没有出嫁的，是为主的事挂虑，要身体、灵魂都圣洁；已经出嫁的，是为世上的事挂虑，想怎样叫丈夫喜悦。
verses.en: and his interests are divided. An unmarried woman or virgin is concerned about the Lord’s affairs: Her aim is to be devoted to the Lord in both body and spirit. But a married woman is concerned about the affairs of this world—how she can please her husband.

verses.zh: 我说这话是为你们的益处，不是要牢笼你们，乃是要叫你们行合宜的事，得以殷勤服侍主，没有分心的事。
verses.en: I am saying this for your own good, not to restrict you, but that you may live in a right way in undivided devotion to the Lord.

verses.zh: 若有人以为自己待他的女儿不合宜，女儿也过了年岁，事又当行，他就可随意办理，不算有罪，叫他们成亲就是了。
verses.en: If anyone is worried that he might not be acting honorably toward the virgin he is engaged to, and if his passions are too strong and he feels he ought to marry, he should do as he wants. He is not sinning. They should get married.

verses.zh: 倘若人心里坚定，没有不得已的事，并且由得自己作主，心里又决定了保守自己的女儿（童女），他就做得好。
verses.en: But the man who has settled the matter in his own mind, who is under no compulsion but has control over his own will, and who has made up his mind not to marry the virgin—this man also does the right thing.

verses.zh: 这样看来，叫自己的女儿出嫁是好，不叫她出嫁更是好。
verses.en: So then, he who marries the virgin does right, but he who does not marry her does better.

verses.zh: 丈夫活着的时候，妻子是被约束的；丈夫若死了，妻子就可以自由，随意再嫁，只是要嫁这在主里面的人。
verses.en: A woman is bound to her husband as long as he lives. But if her husband dies, she is free to marry anyone she wishes, but he must belong to the Lord.

verses.zh: 然而按我的意见，若常守节更有福气。我也想自己是被神的灵感动了。
verses.en: In my judgment, she is happier if she stays as she is—and I think that I too have the Spirit of God.

verses.zh: 论到祭偶像之物，我们晓得我们都有知识。但知识是叫人自高自大，惟有爱心能造就人。
verses.en: Now about food sacrificed to idols: We know that We all possess knowledge. But knowledge puffs up while love builds up.

verses.zh: 若有人以为自己知道甚么，按他所当知道的，他仍是不知道。
verses.en: Those who think they know something do not yet know as they ought to know.

verses.zh: 若有人爱神，这人乃是神所知道的。
verses.en: But whoever loves God is known by God.

verses.zh: 论到吃祭偶像之物，我们知道偶像在世上算不得甚么，也知道神只有一位，再没有别的神。
verses.en: So then, about eating food sacrificed to idols: We know that An idol is nothing at all in the world and that There is no God but one.

verses.zh: 虽有称为神的，或在天，或在地，就如那许多的神，许多的主，
verses.en: For even if there are so-called gods, whether in heaven or on earth (as indeed there are many gods and many lords,

verses.zh: 然而我们只有一位神，就是父，万物都本于他，我们也归于他；并有一位主，就是耶稣基督，万物都是藉着他有的，我们也是藉着他有的。
verses.en: yet for us there is but one God, the Father, from whom all things came and for whom we live; and there is but one Lord, Jesus Christ, through whom all things came and through whom we live.

verses.zh: 然而人不都有这等知识。有人到如今因拜惯了偶像，就以为所吃的是祭偶像之物。这样，他的良心既然软弱，也就污秽了。
verses.en: But not everyone possesses this knowledge. Some people are still so accustomed to idols that when they eat sacrificial food they think of it as having been sacrificed to a god, and since their conscience is weak, it is defiled.

verses.zh: 其实食物不能叫神看中我们，因为我们不吃也无损，吃也无益。
verses.en: But food does not bring us near to God; we are no worse if we do not eat, and no better if we do.

verses.zh: 只是你们要谨慎，恐怕你们这自由竟成了那软弱人的绊脚石。
verses.en: Be careful, however, that the exercise of your rights does not become a stumbling block to the weak.

verses.zh: 若有人见你这有知识的，在偶像的庙里坐席，这人的良心若是软弱，岂不放胆去吃那祭偶像之物吗？
verses.en: For if someone with a weak conscience sees you, with all your knowledge, eating in an idol’s temple, won’t that person be emboldened to eat what is sacrificed to idols?

verses.zh: 因此，基督为这软弱的弟兄死，你这有知识的，倒绊跌了弟兄的良心，这不是犯罪神吗？
verses.en: So this weak brother or sister, for whom Christ died, is destroyed by your knowledge.

verses.zh: 你们这样得罪弟兄们，伤了他们软弱的良心，就是得罪基督。
verses.en: When you sin against them in this way and wound their weak conscience, you sin against Christ.

verses.zh: 所以，食物若叫我弟兄跌倒，我就永远不吃肉，免得叫我弟兄跌倒了。
verses.en: Therefore, if what I eat causes my brother or sister to fall into sin, I will never eat meat again, so that I will not cause them to fall.

verses.zh: 我不是自由的吗？我不是使徒吗？我不是见过我们的主耶稣吗？你们不是我在主里面所作之工吗？
verses.en: Am I not free? Am I not an apostle? Have I not seen Jesus our Lord? Are you not the result of my work in the Lord?

verses.zh: 假若在别人，我不是使徒；在你们，我总是使徒。因为你们在主里正是我作使徒的印证。
verses.en: Even though I may not be an apostle to others, surely I am to you! For you are the seal of my apostleship in the Lord.

verses.zh: 我对那盘问我的人就是这样分诉。
verses.en: This is my defense to those who sit in judgment on me.

verses.zh: 我们岂没有权柄靠福音吃喝吗？
verses.en: Don’t we have the right to food and drink?

verses.zh: 我们岂没有权柄娶信主的姊妹为妻，带着一同往来，仿佛其余的使徒和主的弟兄并矶法一样吗？
verses.en: Don’t we have the right to take a believing wife along with us, as do the other apostles and the Lord’s brothers and Cephas?

verses.zh: 独有我与巴拿巴没有权柄不作工吗？
verses.en: Or is it only I and Barnabas who lack the right to not work for a living?

verses.zh: 有谁当兵自备粮饷呢？有谁栽葡萄园不吃园里的果子呢？有谁牧养牛羊不吃牛羊的奶呢？
verses.en: Who serves as a soldier at his own expense? Who plants a vineyard and does not eat its grapes? Who tends a flock and does not drink the milk?

verses.zh: 我说这话，岂是照人的意见？律法不也是这样说吗？
verses.en: Do I say this merely on human authority? Doesn’t the Law say the same thing?

verses.zh: 就如摩西的律法记着说：牛在场上踹谷的时候，不可笼住它的嘴。难道神所挂念的是牛吗？
verses.en: For it is written in the Law of Moses: Do not muzzle an ox while it is treading out the grain. Is it about oxen that God is concerned?

verses.zh: 不全是为我们说的吗？分明是为我们写的，因为耕种的当存着指望去耕种，打场的也当存着分享的指望去打场。
verses.en: Surely he says this for us, doesn’t he? Yes, this was written for us, because whoever plows and threshes should be able to do so in the hope of sharing in the harvest.

verses.zh: 我们若把属灵的种子撒在你们中间，就是从你们收割奉养肉身之物，这还算大事吗？
verses.en: If we have sown spiritual seed among you, is it too much if we reap a material harvest from you?

verses.zh: 若别人在你们身上有这权柄，何况我们呢？然而，我们没有用过这权柄，却凡事忍受，免得基督的福音被阻隔。
verses.en: If others have this right of support from you, shouldn’t we have it all the more? But we did not use this right. On the contrary, we put up with anything rather than hinder the gospel of Christ.

verses.zh: 你们岂不知为圣事劳碌的就吃殿中的物吗？伺候祭坛的就分领坛上的物吗？
verses.en: Don’t you know that those who serve in the temple get their food from the temple, and that those who serve at the altar share in what is offered on the altar?

verses.zh: 主也是这样命定，叫传福音的靠福音养生。
verses.en: In the same way, the Lord has commanded that those who preach the gospel should receive their living from the gospel.

verses.zh: 但这权柄我全没有用过。我写这话，并非要你们这样待我，因为我宁可死也不叫人使我所夸的落了空。
verses.en: But I have not used any of these rights. And I am not writing this in the hope that you will do such things for me, for I would rather die than allow anyone to deprive me of this boast.

verses.zh: 我传福音原没有可夸的，因为我是不得已的。若不传福音，我便有祸了。
verses.en: For when I preach the gospel, I cannot boast, since I am compelled to preach. Woe to me if I do not preach the gospel!

verses.zh: 我若甘心作这事，就有赏赐；若不甘心，责任却已经托付我了。
verses.en: If I preach voluntarily, I have a reward; if not voluntarily, I am simply discharging the trust committed to me.

verses.zh: 既是这样，我的赏赐是甚么呢？就是我传福音的时候，叫人不花钱得福音，免得用尽我传福音的权柄。
verses.en: What then is my reward? Just this: that in preaching the gospel I may offer it free of charge, and so not make full use of my rights as a preacher of the gospel.

verses.zh: 我虽是自由的，无人辖管，然而我甘心作了众人的仆人，为要多得人。
verses.en: Though I am free and belong to no one, I have made myself a slave to everyone, to win as many as possible.

verses.zh: 向犹太人，我就作犹太人，为要得犹太人；向律法以下的人，我虽不在律法以下，还是作律法以下的人，为要得律法以下的人。
verses.en: To the Jews I became like a Jew, to win the Jews. To those under the law I became like one under the law (though I myself am not under the law), so as to win those under the law.

verses.zh: 向没有律法的人，我就作没有律法的人，为要得没有律法的人；其实我在神面前，不是没有律法；在基督面前，正在律法之下。
verses.en: To those not having the law I became like one not having the law (though I am not free from God’s law but am under Christ’s law), so as to win those not having the law.

verses.zh: 向软弱的人，我就作软弱的人，为要得软弱的人。向甚么样的人，我就作甚么样的人。无论如何，总要救些人。
verses.en: To the weak I became weak, to win the weak. I have become all things to all people so that by all possible means I might save some.

verses.zh: 凡我所行的，都是为福音的缘故，为要与人同得这福音的好处。
verses.en: I do all this for the sake of the gospel, that I may share in its blessings.

verses.zh: 岂不知在场上赛跑的都跑，但得奖赏的只有一人？你们也当这样跑，好叫你们得着奖赏。
verses.en: Do you not know that in a race all the runners run, but only one gets the prize? Run in such a way as to get the prize.

verses.zh: 凡较力争胜的，诸事都有节制，他们不过是要得能坏的冠冕；我们却是要得不能坏的冠冕。
verses.en: Everyone who competes in the games goes into strict training. They do it to get a crown that will not last, but we do it to get a crown that will last forever.

verses.zh: 所以，我奔跑，不像无定向的；我斗拳，不像打空气的。
verses.en: Therefore I do not run like someone running aimlessly; I do not fight like a boxer beating the air.

verses.zh: 我是攻克己身，叫身服我，恐怕我传福音给别人，自己反被弃绝了。
verses.en: No, I strike a blow to my body and make it my slave so that after I have preached to others, I myself will not be disqualified for the prize.

verses.zh: 弟兄们，我不愿意你们不晓得，我们的祖宗从前都在云下，都从海中经过，
verses.en: For I do not want you to be ignorant of the fact, brothers and sisters, that our ancestors were all under the cloud and that they all passed through the sea.

verses.zh: 都在云里、海里受洗归了摩西，
verses.en: They were all baptized into Moses in the cloud and in the sea.

verses.zh: 并且都吃了一样的灵食，
verses.en: They all ate the same spiritual food

verses.zh: 也都喝了一样的灵水。所喝的是出于随着他们的灵磐石；那磐石就是基督。
verses.en: and drank the same spiritual drink; for they drank from the spiritual rock that accompanied them, and that rock was Christ.

verses.zh: 但他们中间，多半是神不喜欢的人，所以在旷野倒毙。
verses.en: Nevertheless, God was not pleased with most of them; their bodies were scattered in the wilderness.

verses.zh: 这些事都是我们的鉴戒，叫我们不要贪恋恶事，像他们那样贪恋的。
verses.en: Now these things occurred as examples to keep us from setting our hearts on evil things as they did.

verses.zh: 也不要拜偶像，像他们有人拜的。如经上所记：百姓坐下吃喝，起来玩耍。
verses.en: Do not be idolaters, as some of them were; as it is written: The people sat down to eat and drink and got up to indulge in revelry.

verses.zh: 我们也不要行淫，像他们有人行的，一天就倒毙了二万三千人。
verses.en: We should not commit sexual immorality, as some of them did—and in one day twenty-three thousand of them died.

verses.zh: 也不要试探主，像他们有人试探的，就被蛇所灭。
verses.en: We should not test the Lord, as some of them did—and were killed by snakes.

verses.zh: 你们也不要发怨言，像他们有发怨言的，就被灭命的所灭。
verses.en: And do not grumble, as some of them did—and were killed by the destroying angel.

verses.zh: 他们遭遇这些事，都要作为鉴戒，并且写在经上，正是警戒我们这末世的人。
verses.en: These things happened to them as examples and were written down as warnings for us, on whom the culmination of the ages has come.

verses.zh: 所以，自己以为站得稳的，须要谨慎，免得跌倒。
verses.en: So, if you think you are standing firm, be careful that you don’t fall!

verses.zh: 你们所遇见的试探，无非是人所能受的。神是信实的，必不叫你们受试探过于所能受的；在受试探的时候，总要给你们开一条出路，叫你们能忍受得住。
verses.en: No temptation has overtaken you except what is common to mankind. And God is faithful; he will not let you be tempted beyond what you can bear. But when you are tempted, he will also provide a way out so that you can endure it.

verses.zh: 我所亲爱的弟兄啊，你们要逃避拜偶像的事。
verses.en: Therefore, my dear friends, flee from idolatry.

verses.zh: 我好像对明白人说的，你们要审察我的话。
verses.en: I speak to sensible people; judge for yourselves what I say.

verses.zh: 我们所祝福的杯，岂不是同领基督的血吗？我们所擘开的饼，岂不是同领基督的身体吗？
verses.en: Is not the cup of thanksgiving for which we give thanks a participation in the blood of Christ? And is not the bread that we break a participation in the body of Christ?

verses.zh: 我们虽多，仍是一个饼，一个身体，因为我们都是分受这一个饼。
verses.en: Because there is one loaf, we, who are many, are one body, for we all share the one loaf.

verses.zh: 你们看属肉体的以色列人，那吃祭物的岂不是在祭坛上有分吗？
verses.en: Consider the people of Israel: Do not those who eat the sacrifices participate in the altar?

verses.zh: 我是怎么说呢？岂是说祭偶像之物算得甚么呢？或说偶像算得甚么呢？
verses.en: Do I mean then that food sacrificed to an idol is anything, or that an idol is anything?

verses.zh: 我乃是说，外邦人所献的祭是祭鬼，不是祭神。我不愿意你们与鬼相交。
verses.en: No, but the sacrifices of pagans are offered to demons, not to God, and I do not want you to be participants with demons.

verses.zh: 你们不能喝主的杯，又喝鬼的杯；不能吃主的筵席，又吃鬼的筵席。
verses.en: You cannot drink the cup of the Lord and the cup of demons too; you cannot have a part in both the Lord’s table and the table of demons.

verses.zh: 我们可惹主的愤恨吗？我们比他还有能力吗？
verses.en: Are we trying to arouse the Lord’s jealousy? Are we stronger than he?

verses.zh: 凡事都可行，但不都有益处。凡事都可行，但不都造就人。
verses.en: I have the right to do anything, you say—but not everything is beneficial. I have the right to do anything—but not everything is constructive.

verses.zh: 无论何人，不要求自己的益处，乃要求别人的益处。
verses.en: No one should seek their own good, but the good of others.

verses.zh: 凡市上所卖的，你们只管吃，不要为良心的缘故问甚么话。
verses.en: Eat anything sold in the meat market without raising questions of conscience,

verses.zh: 因为地和其中所充满的，都属乎主。
verses.en: for, The earth is the Lord’s, and everything in it.

verses.zh: 若有不信的人请你们赴席，你们若愿意去，凡摆在你们面前的，只管吃，不要为良心的缘故问甚么话。
verses.en: If an unbeliever invites you to a meal and you want to go, eat whatever is put before you without raising questions of conscience.

verses.zh: 若有人对你们说：这是献过祭的物，就不要为那告诉你们的人吃那物。
verses.en: But if someone says to you, This has been offered in sacrifice, then do not eat it, both for the sake of the one who told you and for conscience’ sake—

verses.zh: 我说的良心，不是你自己的，乃是别人的。我这自由，为什么被别人的良心论断呢？
verses.en: I am referring to the other person’s conscience, not yours. For why is my freedom being judged by another’s conscience?

verses.zh: 我若谢恩而吃，为什么因我谢恩的物被人毁谤呢？
verses.en: If I take part in the meal with thankfulness, why am I denounced because of something I thank God for?

verses.zh: 所以，你们或吃或喝，无论作甚么，都要为荣耀神而行。
verses.en: So whether you eat or drink or whatever you do, do it all for the glory of God.

verses.zh: 不要叫犹太人、希利尼人、外邦人跌倒，
verses.en: Do not cause anyone to stumble, whether Jews, Greeks or the church of God—

verses.zh: 就好像我凡事都叫众人喜欢，不求自己的益处，只求众人的益处，叫他们得救。
verses.en: even as I try to please everyone in every way. For I am not seeking my own good but the good of many, so that they may be saved.

verses.zh: 你们该效法我，像我效法基督一样。
verses.en: Follow my example, as I follow the example of Christ.

verses.zh: 我称赞你们，因你们凡事记念我，又坚守我所传给你们的。
verses.en: I praise you for remembering me in everything and for holding to the traditions just as I passed them on to you.

verses.zh: 我愿意你们知道，基督是各人的头；男人是女人的头；神是基督的头。
verses.en: But I want you to realize that the head of every man is Christ, and the head of the woman is man, and the head of Christ is God.

verses.zh: 凡男人祷告或是讲道，若蒙着头，就羞辱自己的头。
verses.en: Every man who prays or prophesies with his head covered dishonors his head.

verses.zh: 凡女人祷告或是讲道，若不蒙着头，就羞辱自己的头，因为这就如同剃了头发一样。
verses.en: But every woman who prays or prophesies with her head uncovered dishonors her head—it is the same as having her head shaved.

verses.zh: 女人若不蒙着头，就该剪了头发；女人若以剪发剃发为羞愧，就该蒙着头。
verses.en: For if a woman does not cover her head, she might as well have her hair cut off; but if it is a disgrace for a woman to have her hair cut off or her head shaved, then she should cover her head.

verses.zh: 男人本不该蒙着头，因为他是神的形像和荣耀；但女人是男人的荣耀。
verses.en: A man ought not to cover his head, since he is the image and glory of God; but woman is the glory of man.

verses.zh: 起初，男人不是由女人而出，女人乃是由男人而出。
verses.en: For man did not come from woman, but woman from man;

verses.zh: 并且男人不是为女人造的，女人乃是为男人造的。
verses.en: neither was man created for woman, but woman for man.

verses.zh: 因此，女人为天使的缘故，应当在头上有服权柄的记号。
verses.en: It is for this reason that a woman ought to have authority over her own head, because of the angels.

verses.zh: 然而，在主里面，女人和男人也不无分别，男人也离不开女人，女人也离不开男人。
verses.en: Nevertheless, in the Lord woman is not independent of man, nor is man independent of woman.

verses.zh: 因为女人原是由男人而出，男人也是由女人而出；但万有都是出乎神。
verses.en: For as woman came from man, so also man is born of woman. But everything comes from God.

verses.zh: 你们自己审察，女人祷告神，不蒙着头，是合宜的吗？
verses.en: Judge for yourselves: Is it proper for a woman to pray to God with her head uncovered?

verses.zh: 你们的本性不也指示你们，男人若有长头发，便是他的羞辱吗？
verses.en: Does not the very nature of things teach you that if a man has long hair, it is a disgrace to him,

verses.zh: 但女人有长头发，乃是她的荣耀，因为这头发是给她作盖头的。
verses.en: but that if a woman has long hair, it is her glory? For long hair is given to her as a covering.

verses.zh: 若有人想要辩驳，我们却没有这样的规矩，神的众教会也是没有的。
verses.en: If anyone wants to be contentious about this, we have no other practice—nor do the churches of God.

verses.zh: 我现今吩咐你们的话，不是称赞你们；因为你们聚会不是受益，乃是招损。
verses.en: In the following directives I have no praise for you, for your meetings do more harm than good.

verses.zh: 第一，我听说，你们聚会的时候彼此分门别类，也有些信这话。
verses.en: In the first place, I hear that when you come together as a church, there are divisions among you, and to some extent I believe it.

verses.zh: 在你们中间不免有分门结党的事，好叫那些有经验的人显明出来。
verses.en: No doubt there have to be differences among you to show which of you have God’s approval.

verses.zh: 你们聚会的时候，算不得吃主的晚餐。
verses.en: So then, when you come together, it is not the Lord’s Supper you eat,

verses.zh: 因为吃的时候，各人先吃自己的饭，甚至这个饥饿，那个酒醉。
verses.en: for when you are eating, some of you go ahead with your own private meals. As a result, one person remains hungry and another gets drunk.

verses.zh: 你们要吃喝，难道没有家吗？还是藐视神的教会，叫那没有的羞愧呢？我向你们可怎么说呢？可因此称赞你们吗？我不称赞！
verses.en: Don’t you have homes to eat and drink in? Or do you despise the church of God by humiliating those who have nothing? What shall I say to you? Shall I praise you? Certainly not in this matter!

verses.zh: 我当日传给你们的，原是从主领受的，就是主耶稣被卖的那一夜，拿起饼来，
verses.en: For I received from the Lord what I also passed on to you: The Lord Jesus, on the night he was betrayed, took bread,

verses.zh: 祝谢了，就擘开，说：这是我的身体，为你们舍的，你们应当如此行，为的是记念我。
verses.en: and when he had given thanks, he broke it and said, This is my body, which is for you; do this in remembrance of me.

verses.zh: 饭后，也照样拿起杯来，说：这杯是用我的血所立的新约，你们每逢喝的时候，要如此行，为的是记念我。
verses.en: In the same way, after supper he took the cup, saying, This cup is the new covenant in my blood; do this, whenever you drink it, in remembrance of me.

verses.zh: 你们每逢吃这饼，喝这杯，是表明主的死，直等到他来。
verses.en: For whenever you eat this bread and drink this cup, you proclaim the Lord’s death until he comes.

verses.zh: 所以，无论何人，不按理吃主的饼，喝主的杯，就是干犯主的身主的血了。
verses.en: So then, whoever eats the bread or drinks the cup of the Lord in an unworthy manner will be guilty of sinning against the body and blood of the Lord.

verses.zh: 人应当自己省察，然后吃这饼，喝这杯。
verses.en: Everyone ought to examine themselves before they eat of the bread and drink from the cup.

verses.zh: 因为人吃喝，若不分辨是主的身体，就是吃喝自己的罪了。
verses.en: For those who eat and drink without discerning the body of Christ eat and drink judgment on themselves.

verses.zh: 因此，在你们中间有好些软弱的与患病的，死的人也不少。
verses.en: That is why many among you are weak and sick, and a number of you have fallen asleep.

verses.zh: 我们若是先省察自己，就不至于受审。
verses.en: But if we were more discerning with regard to ourselves, we would not come under such judgment.

verses.zh: 我们受审的时候，乃是被主惩治，免得我们和世人一同定罪。
verses.en: Nevertheless, when we are judged in this way by the Lord, we are being disciplined so that we will not be finally condemned with the world.

verses.zh: 所以，我弟兄们，你们聚会吃的时候，要彼此等待。
verses.en: So then, my brothers and sisters, when you gather to eat, you should all eat together.

verses.zh: 若有人饥饿，可以在家里先吃，免得你们聚会，自己取罪。其余的事，我来的时候再安排。
verses.en: Anyone who is hungry should eat something at home, so that when you meet together it may not result in judgment. And when I come I will give further directions.

verses.zh: 弟兄们，论到属灵的恩赐，我不愿意你们不明白。
verses.en: Now about the gifts of the Spirit, brothers and sisters, I do not want you to be uninformed.

verses.zh: 你们知道，你们从前作外邦人的时候，随从那些哑巴偶像，是怎样被牵引，受迷惑的。
verses.en: You know that when you were pagans, somehow or other you were influenced and led astray to mute idols.

verses.zh: 所以我告诉你们，被神的灵感动的，没有说耶稣是可咒诅的；若不是被圣灵感动的，也没有能说耶稣是主的。
verses.en: Therefore I want you to know that no one who is speaking by the Spirit of God says, Jesus be cursed, and no one can say, Jesus is Lord, except by the Holy Spirit.

verses.zh: 恩赐原有分别，圣灵却是一位。
verses.en: There are different kinds of gifts, but the same Spirit distributes them.

verses.zh: 职事也有分别，主却是一位。
verses.en: There are different kinds of service, but the same Lord.

verses.zh: 功用也有分别，神却是一位，在众人里面运行一切的事。
verses.en: There are different kinds of working, but in all of them and in everyone it is the same God at work.

verses.zh: 圣灵显在各人身上，是叫人得益处。
verses.en: Now to each one the manifestation of the Spirit is given for the common good.

verses.zh: 这人蒙圣灵赐他智慧的言语，那人也蒙这位圣灵赐他知识的言语，
verses.en: To one there is given through the Spirit a message of wisdom, to another a message of knowledge by means of the same Spirit,

verses.zh: 又有一人蒙这位圣灵赐他信心，还有一人蒙这位圣灵赐他医病的恩赐，
verses.en: to another faith by the same Spirit, to another gifts of healing by that one Spirit,

verses.zh: 又叫一人能行异能，又叫一人能作先知，又叫一人能辨别诸灵，又叫一人能说方言，又叫一人能翻方言。
verses.en: to another miraculous powers, to another prophecy, to another distinguishing between spirits, to another speaking in different kinds of tongues, and to still another the interpretation of tongues.

verses.zh: 这一切都是这位圣灵所运行，随己意分给各人的。
verses.en: All these are the work of one and the same Spirit, and he distributes them to each one, just as he determines.

verses.zh: 就如身子是一个，却有许多肢体；而且肢体虽多，仍是一个身子；基督也是这样。
verses.en: Just as a body, though one, has many parts, but all its many parts form one body, so it is with Christ.

verses.zh: 我们不拘是犹太人，是希利尼人，是为奴的，是自主的，都从一位圣灵受洗，成了一个身体，饮于一位圣灵。
verses.en: For we were all baptized by one Spirit so as to form one body—whether Jews or Gentiles, slave or free—and we were all given the one Spirit to drink.

verses.zh: 身子原不是一个肢体，乃是许多。
verses.en: Even so the body is not made up of one part but of many.

verses.zh: 设若脚说：我不是手，所以不属乎身子；它不能因此就不属乎身子。
verses.en: Now if the foot should say, Because I am not a hand, I do not belong to the body, it would not for that reason stop being part of the body.

verses.zh: 设若耳说：我不是眼，所以不属乎身子；它也不能因此就不属乎身子。
verses.en: And if the ear should say, Because I am not an eye, I do not belong to the body, it would not for that reason stop being part of the body.

verses.zh: 若全身是眼，从哪里听声呢？若全身是耳，从哪里闻味呢？
verses.en: If the whole body were an eye, where would the sense of hearing be? If the whole body were an ear, where would the sense of smell be?

verses.zh: 但如今，神随自己的意思把肢体俱各安排在身上了。
verses.en: But in fact God has placed the parts in the body, every one of them, just as he wanted them to be.

verses.zh: 若都是一个肢体，身子在哪里呢？
verses.en: If they were all one part, where would the body be?

verses.zh: 但如今肢体是多的，身子却是一个。
verses.en: As it is, there are many parts, but one body.

verses.zh: 眼不能对手说：我用不着你；头也不能对脚说：我用不着你。
verses.en: The eye cannot say to the hand, I don’t need you! And the head cannot say to the feet, I don’t need you!

verses.zh: 不但如此，身上肢体人以为软弱的，更是不可少的。
verses.en: On the contrary, those parts of the body that seem to be weaker are indispensable,

verses.zh: 身上肢体，我们看为不体面的，越发给它加上体面；不俊美的，越发得着俊美。
verses.en: and the parts that we think are less honorable we treat with special honor. And the parts that are unpresentable are treated with special modesty,

verses.zh: 我们俊美的肢体，自然用不着装饰。但神配搭这身子，把加倍的体面给那有缺欠的肢体，
verses.en: while our presentable parts need no special treatment. But God has put the body together, giving greater honor to the parts that lacked it,

verses.zh: 免得身上分门别类，总要肢体彼此相顾。
verses.en: so that there should be no division in the body, but that its parts should have equal concern for each other.

verses.zh: 若一个肢体受苦，所有的肢体就一同受苦；若一个肢体得荣耀，所有的肢体就一同快乐。
verses.en: If one part suffers, every part suffers with it; if one part is honored, every part rejoices with it.

verses.zh: 你们就是基督的身子，并且各自作肢体。
verses.en: Now you are the body of Christ, and each one of you is a part of it.

verses.zh: 神在教会所设立的：第一是使徒，第二是先知，第三是教师，其次是行异能的，再次是得恩赐医病的，帮助人的，治理事的，说方言的。
verses.en: And God has placed in the church first of all apostles, second prophets, third teachers, then miracles, then gifts of healing, of helping, of guidance, and of different kinds of tongues.

verses.zh: 岂都是使徒吗？岂都是先知吗？岂都是教师吗？岂都是行异能的吗？
verses.en: Are all apostles? Are all prophets? Are all teachers? Do all work miracles?

verses.zh: 岂都是得恩赐医病的吗？岂都是说方言的吗？岂都是翻方言的吗？
verses.en: Do all have gifts of healing? Do all speak in tongues? Do all interpret?

verses.zh: 你们要切切地求那更大的恩赐。我还要指示你们一条最妙的道路来。
verses.en: Now eagerly desire the greater gifts. And yet I will show you the most excellent way.

verses.zh: 我若能说万人的方言，并天使的话语，却没有爱，我就成了鸣的锣，响的钹一般。
verses.en: If I speak in the tongues of men or of angels, but do not have love, I am only a resounding gong or a clanging cymbal.

verses.zh: 我若有先知讲道之能，也明白各样的奥秘，各样的知识，而且有全备的信，叫我能够移山，却没有爱，我就算不得甚么。
verses.en: If I have the gift of prophecy and can fathom all mysteries and all knowledge, and if I have a faith that can move mountains, but do not have love, I am nothing.

verses.zh: 我若将所有的周济穷人，又舍己身叫人焚烧，却没有爱，仍然与我无益。
verses.en: If I give all I possess to the poor and give over my body to hardship that I may boast, but do not have love, I gain nothing.

verses.zh: 爱是恒久忍耐，又有恩慈；爱是不嫉妒；爱是不自夸，不张狂，
verses.en: Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud.

verses.zh: 不作害羞的事，不求自己的益处，不轻易发怒，不计算人的恶，
verses.en: It does not dishonor others, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs.

verses.zh: 不喜欢不义，只喜欢真理；
verses.en: Love does not delight in evil but rejoices with the truth.

verses.zh: 凡事包容，凡事相信，凡事盼望，凡事忍耐。
verses.en: It always protects, always trusts, always hopes, always perseveres.

verses.zh: 爱是永不止息。先知讲道之能终必归于无有；说方言之能终必停止；知识也终必归于无有。
verses.en: Love never fails. But where there are prophecies, they will cease; where there are tongues, they will be stilled; where there is knowledge, it will pass away.

verses.zh: 我们现在所知道的有限，先知所讲的也有限，
verses.en: For we know in part and we prophesy in part,

verses.zh: 等那完全的来到，这有限的必归于无有了。
verses.en: but when completeness comes, what is in part disappears.

verses.zh: 我作孩子的时候，话语像孩子，心思像孩子，意念像孩子；既成了人，就把孩子的事丢弃了。
verses.en: When I was a child, I talked like a child, I thought like a child, I reasoned like a child. When I became a man, I put the ways of childhood behind me.

verses.zh: 我们如今仿佛对着镜子观看，模糊不清，到那时，就要面对面了。我如今所知道的有限，到那时就全知道，如同主知道我一样。
verses.en: For now we see only a reflection as in a mirror; then we shall see face to face. Now I know in part; then I shall know fully, even as I am fully known.

verses.zh: 如今常存的有信，有望，有爱这三样，其中最大的是爱。
verses.en: And now these three remain: faith, hope and love. But the greatest of these is love.

verses.zh: 你们要追求爱，也要切慕属灵的恩赐，其中更要羡慕的，是作先知讲道。
verses.en: Follow the way of love and eagerly desire gifts of the Spirit, especially prophecy.

verses.zh: 那说方言的，原不是对人说，乃是对神说，因为没有人听出来。然而，他在心灵里却是讲说各样的奥秘。
verses.en: For anyone who speaks in a tongue does not speak to people but to God. Indeed, no one understands them; they utter mysteries by the Spirit.

verses.zh: 但作先知讲道的，是对人说，要造就、安慰、劝勉人。
verses.en: But the one who prophesies speaks to people for their strengthening, encouraging and comfort.

verses.zh: 说方言的，是造就自己；作先知讲道的，乃是造就教会。
verses.en: Anyone who speaks in a tongue edifies themselves, but the one who prophesies edifies the church.

verses.zh: 我愿意你们都说方言，更愿意你们作先知讲道。因为说方言的，若不翻出来，使教会得造就，那作先知讲道的，就比他强了。
verses.en: I would like every one of you to speak in tongues, but I would rather have you prophesy. The one who prophesies is greater than the one who speaks in tongues, unless someone interprets, so that the church may be edified.

verses.zh: 弟兄们，我到你们那里去，若只说方言，不用启示，或知识，或预言，或教训，给你们讲解，我与你们有甚么益处呢？
verses.en: Now, brothers and sisters, if I come to you and speak in tongues, what good will I be to you, unless I bring you some revelation or knowledge or prophecy or word of instruction?

verses.zh: 就是那有声无气的物，或箫，或琴，若发出来的声音没有分别，怎能知道所吹所弹的是甚么呢？
verses.en: Even in the case of lifeless things that make sounds, such as the pipe or harp, how will anyone know what tune is being played unless there is a distinction in the notes?

verses.zh: 若吹无定的号声，谁能预备打仗呢？
verses.en: Again, if the trumpet does not sound a clear call, who will get ready for battle?

verses.zh: 你们也是如此，舌头若不说容易明白的话，怎能知道所说的是甚么呢？这就是向空说话了。
verses.en: So it is with you. Unless you speak intelligible words with your tongue, how will anyone know what you are saying? You will just be speaking into the air.

verses.zh: 世上的声音，或者甚多，却没有一样是无意思的。
verses.en: Undoubtedly there are all sorts of languages in the world, yet none of them is without meaning.

verses.zh: 我若不明白那声音的意思，这说话的人必以我为化外之人，我也以他为化外之人。
verses.en: If then I do not grasp the meaning of what someone is saying, I am a foreigner to the speaker, and the speaker is a foreigner to me.

verses.zh: 你们也是如此，既是切慕属灵的恩赐，就当求多得造就教会的恩赐。
verses.en: So it is with you. Since you are eager for gifts of the Spirit, try to excel in those that build up the church.

verses.zh: 因此，那说方言的，就当求着能翻方言。
verses.en: For this reason the one who speaks in a tongue should pray that they may interpret what they say.

verses.zh: 我若用方言祷告，是我的灵祷告，但我的悟性没有果效。
verses.en: For if I pray in a tongue, my spirit prays, but my mind is unfruitful.

verses.zh: 这却怎么样呢？我要用灵祷告，也要用悟性祷告；我要用灵歌唱，也要用悟性歌唱。
verses.en: So what shall I do? I will pray with my spirit, but I will also pray with my understanding; I will sing with my spirit, but I will also sing with my understanding.

verses.zh: 不然，你用灵祝谢，那在座的不明白的人，听见你阿们，怎么能说呢？
verses.en: Otherwise when you are praising God in the Spirit, how can someone else, who is now put in the position of an inquirer, say Amen to your thanksgiving, since they do not know what you are saying?

verses.zh: 你感谢得不错，但别人得不着造就。
verses.en: You are giving thanks well enough, but no one else is edified.

verses.zh: 感谢神，我说方言比你们众人还多。
verses.en: I thank God that I speak in tongues more than all of you.

verses.zh: 但在教会中，宁可用悟性说五句教导人的话，强如说万句方言。
verses.en: But in the church I would rather speak five intelligible words to instruct others than ten thousand words in a tongue.

verses.zh: 弟兄们，在心志上不要作小孩子；然而在恶事上要作婴孩，在心志上总要作大人。
verses.en: Brothers and sisters, stop thinking like children. In regard to evil be infants, but in your thinking be adults.

verses.zh: 律法上记着说：主说，我要用外邦人的舌头和外邦人的嘴唇向这百姓说话，虽然如此，他们还是不听从我。
verses.en: In the Law it is written: With other tongues and through the lips of foreigners I will speak to this people, but even then they will not listen to me, says the Lord.

verses.zh: 这样看来，说方言不是为信的人作证据，乃是为不信的人；作先知讲道，不是为不信的人，乃是为信的人作证据。
verses.en: Tongues, then, are a sign, not for believers but for unbelievers; prophecy, however, is not for unbelievers but for believers.

verses.zh: 所以，全教会聚在一处的时候，若都说方言，偶然有不通方言的，或是不信的人进来，岂不说你们癫狂了吗？
verses.en: So if the whole church comes together and everyone speaks in tongues, and inquirers or unbelievers come in, will they not say that you are out of your mind?

verses.zh: 若都作先知讲道，偶然有不信的，或是不通方言的人进来，就被众人劝醒，被众人审明，
verses.en: But if an unbeliever or an inquirer comes in while everyone is prophesying, they are convicted of sin and are brought under judgment by all,

verses.zh: 他心里的隐情显露出来，就必将脸伏地，敬拜神，说：神真是在你们中间了。
verses.en: as the secrets of their hearts are laid bare. So they will fall down and worship God, exclaiming, God is really among you!

verses.zh: 弟兄们，这却怎么样呢？你们聚会的时候，各人或有诗歌，或有教训，或有启示，或有方言，或有翻出来的话，凡事都当造就人。
verses.en: What then shall we say, brothers and sisters? When you come together, each of you has a hymn, or a word of instruction, a revelation, a tongue or an interpretation. Everything must be done so that the church may be built up.

verses.zh: 若有说方言的，只好两个人，至多三个人，且要轮流着说，也要有翻方言的。
verses.en: If anyone speaks in a tongue, two—or at the most three—should speak, one at a time, and someone must interpret.

verses.zh: 若没有人翻，就当在会中闭口，只对自己和神说就是了。
verses.en: If there is no interpreter, the speaker should keep quiet in the church and speak to himself and to God.

verses.zh: 至于作先知讲道的，只好两个人，或是三个人，其余的就当慎思明辨。
verses.en: Two or three prophets should speak, and the others should weigh carefully what is said.

verses.zh: 若旁边坐着的得了启示，那先说话的就当闭口不言。
verses.en: And if a revelation comes to someone who is sitting down, the first speaker should stop.

verses.zh: 因为你们都可以一个一个地作先知讲道，叫众人学道理，叫众人得劝勉。
verses.en: For you can all prophesy in turn so that everyone may be instructed and encouraged.

verses.zh: 先知的灵原是顺服先知的，
verses.en: The spirits of prophets are subject to the control of prophets.

verses.zh: 因为神不是叫人混乱，乃是叫人安静。
verses.en: For God is not a God of disorder but of peace—as in all the congregations of the Lord’s people.

verses.zh: 妇女在会中要闭口不言，像在圣徒的众教会一样，因为不准她们说话。她们总要顺服，正如律法所说的。
verses.en: Women should remain silent in the churches. They are not allowed to speak, but must be in submission, as the law says.

verses.zh: 她们若要学甚么，可以在家里问自己的丈夫，因为妇女在会中说话原是可耻的。
verses.en: If they want to inquire about something, they should ask their own husbands at home; for it is disgraceful for a woman to speak in the church.

verses.zh: 神的道理岂是从你们出来吗？岂是单临到你们吗？
verses.en: Or did the word of God originate with you? Or are you the only people it has reached?

verses.zh: 若有人以为自己是先知，或是属灵的，就该知道，我所写给你们的是主的命令。
verses.en: If anyone thinks they are a prophet or otherwise gifted by the Spirit, let them acknowledge that what I am writing to you is the Lord’s command.

verses.zh: 若有人不理会，就由他不理会吧。
verses.en: But if anyone ignores this, they will themselves be ignored.

verses.zh: 所以，我弟兄们，你们要切慕作先知讲道，也不要禁止说方言。
verses.en: Therefore, my brothers and sisters, be eager to prophesy, and do not forbid speaking in tongues.

verses.zh: 凡事都要规规矩矩地按着次序行。
verses.en: But everything should be done in a fitting and orderly way.

verses.zh: 弟兄们，我如今把先前所传给你们的福音，提起来叫你们记念。这福音你们也领受了，又靠着站立得住。
verses.en: Now, brothers and sisters, I want to remind you of the gospel I preached to you, which you received and on which you have taken your stand.

verses.zh: 你们若不是徒然相信，能以持守我所传给你们的，就必因这福音得救。
verses.en: By this gospel you are saved, if you hold firmly to the word I preached to you. Otherwise, you have believed in vain.

verses.zh: 我当日所领受又传给你们的，第一，就是基督照圣经所说，为我们的罪死了，
verses.en: For what I received I passed on to you as of first importance: that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures,

verses.zh: 而且埋葬了，又照圣经所说，第三天复活了，
verses.en: that he was buried, that he was raised on the third day according to the Scriptures,

verses.zh: 并且显给矶法看，然后显给十二使徒看，
verses.en: and that he appeared to Cephas, and then to the Twelve.

verses.zh: 后来一时显给五百多弟兄看，其中一大半到如今还在，却也有已经睡了的。
verses.en: After that, he appeared to more than five hundred of the brothers and sisters at the same time, most of whom are still living, though some have fallen asleep.

verses.zh: 以后显给雅各看，再显给众使徒看，
verses.en: Then he appeared to James, then to all the apostles,

verses.zh: 末了也显给我看；我如同未到产期而生的人一般。
verses.en: and last of all he appeared to me also, as to one abnormally born.

verses.zh: 我原是使徒中最小的，不配称为使徒，因为我从前逼迫神的教会。
verses.en: For I am the least of the apostles and do not even deserve to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.

verses.zh: 然而，我今日成了何等人，是蒙神的恩才成的，并且他所赐我的恩不是徒然的。我比众使徒格外劳苦；这原不是我，乃是神的恩与我同在。
verses.en: But by the grace of God I am what I am, and his grace to me was not without effect. No, I worked harder than all of them—yet not I, but the grace of God that was with me.

verses.zh: 无论是他们，是我，我们如此传，你们也如此信了。
verses.en: Whether, then, it is I or they, this is what we preach, and this is what you believed.

verses.zh: 既传基督是从死里复活了，若有人说没有死人复活的事，为什么在你们中间有人说没有死人复活的事呢？
verses.en: But if it is preached that Christ has been raised from the dead, how can some of you say that there is no resurrection of the dead?

verses.zh: 若没有死人复活的事，基督也就没有复活了。
verses.en: If there is no resurrection of the dead, then not even Christ has been raised.

verses.zh: 若基督没有复活，我们所传的便是枉然，你们所信的也是枉然。
verses.en: And if Christ has not been raised, our preaching is in vain and your faith is in vain.

verses.zh: 并且明显我们是为神妄作见证的，因我们见证神是叫基督复活了。若死人真不复活，神也就没有叫基督复活了。
verses.en: We are then found to be false witnesses about God, for we have testified about God that he raised Christ from the dead. But he did not raise him if in fact the dead are not raised.

verses.zh: 因为若死人不复活，基督也就没有复活了。
verses.en: For if the dead are not raised, then Christ has not been raised either.

verses.zh: 若基督没有复活，你们的信便是徒然，你们仍在罪里。
verses.en: And if Christ has not been raised, your faith is futile; you are still in your sins.

verses.zh: 就是在基督里睡了的人也灭亡了。
verses.en: Then those also who have fallen asleep in Christ are lost.

verses.zh: 我们若靠基督只在今生有指望，就算比众人更可怜。
verses.en: If only for this life we have hope in Christ, we are of all people most to be pitied.

verses.zh: 但基督已经从死里复活，成为睡了之人初熟的果子。
verses.en: But Christ has indeed been raised from the dead, the firstfruits of those who have fallen asleep.

verses.zh: 死既是因一人而来，死人复活也是因一人而来。
verses.en: For since death came through a man, the resurrection of the dead comes also through a man.

verses.zh: 在亚当里众人都死了；照样，在基督里众人也都要复活。
verses.en: For as in Adam all die, so in Christ all will be made alive.

verses.zh: 但各人是按着自己的次序复活：初熟的果子是基督；以后在他来的时候，是那些属基督的。
verses.en: But each in turn: Christ, the firstfruits; then, when he comes, those who belong to him.

verses.zh: 再后，末期到了，那时基督既将一切执政的、掌权的、有能的都毁灭了，就把国交与父神。
verses.en: Then the end will come, when he hands over the kingdom to God the Father after he has destroyed all dominion, authority and power.

verses.zh: 因为基督必要作王，等神把一切仇敌都放在他的脚下。
verses.en: For he must reign until he has put all his enemies under his feet.

verses.zh: 尽末了所毁灭的仇敌就是死。
verses.en: The last enemy to be destroyed is death.

verses.zh: 因为经上说：神叫万物都服在他的脚下。既说万物都服了他，明显那叫万物服他的，不在其内了。
verses.en: For he has put everything under his feet. Now when it says that everything has been put under him, it is clear that this does not include God himself, who put everything under Christ.

verses.zh: 万物既服了他，那时，子也要自己服那叫万物服他的，叫神在万物之上，为万物之主。
verses.en: When he has done this, then the Son himself will be made subject to him who put everything under him, so that God may be all in all.

verses.zh: 不然，那些为死人受洗的，将来怎样呢？若死人总不复活，因何为他们受洗呢？
verses.en: Now if there is no resurrection, what will those do who get baptized for the dead? If the dead are not raised at all, why are people baptized for them?

verses.zh: 我们又因何时刻冒险呢？
verses.en: And as for us, why do we endanger ourselves every hour?

verses.zh: 弟兄们，我在我主基督耶稣里，指着你们所夸的，郑重地说，我是天天死。若我在以弗所同野兽战斗，那于我有甚么益处呢？
verses.en: I face death every day—yes, just as surely as I boast about you in Christ Jesus our Lord.

verses.zh: 若死人不复活，我们就吃吃喝喝吧！因为明天要死了。
verses.en: If I fought wild beasts in Ephesus with no more than human hopes, what have I gained? If the dead are not raised, Let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die.

verses.zh: 你们不要自欺，滥交是败坏善行。
verses.en: Do not be misled: Bad company corrupts good character.

verses.zh: 你们要醒悟为善，不要犯罪，因为有人不认识神。我说这话是要叫你们羞愧。
verses.en: Come back to your senses as you ought, and stop sinning; for there are some who are ignorant of God—I say this to your shame.

verses.zh: 或有人问：死人怎样复活，带着甚么身体来呢？
verses.en: But someone will ask, How are the dead raised? With what kind of body will they come?

verses.zh: 无知的人哪，你所种的，若不死就不能生。
verses.en: How foolish! What you sow does not come to life unless it dies.

verses.zh: 并且你所种的，不是那将来的形体，不过是子粒，即如麦子，或是别样的谷。
verses.en: When you sow, you do not plant the body that will be, but just a seed, perhaps of wheat or of something else.

verses.zh: 但神随自己的意思给它一个形体，并叫各等子粒各有自己的形体。
verses.en: But God gives it a body as he has determined, and to each kind of seed he gives its own body.

verses.zh: 凡肉体不都是一样，乃有分别：人是一样，兽又是一样，鸟又是一样，鱼又是一样。
verses.en: Not all flesh is the same: People have one kind of flesh, animals another, birds another and fish another.

verses.zh: 有天上的形体，也有地上的形体；但天上形体的荣光是一样，地上形体的荣光又是一样。
verses.en: There are also heavenly bodies and there are earthly bodies; but the splendor of the heavenly bodies is one kind, and the splendor of the earthly bodies is another.

verses.zh: 日有日的荣光，月有月的荣光，星有星的荣光；这星和那星的荣光也有分别。
verses.en: The sun has one kind of splendor, the moon another and the stars another; and star differs from star in splendor.

verses.zh: 死人复活也是这样：所种的是必朽坏的，复活的是不朽坏的；
verses.en: So will it be with the resurrection of the dead. The body that is sown is perishable, it is raised imperishable;

verses.zh: 所种的是羞辱的，复活的是荣耀的；所种的是软弱的，复活的是强壮的；
verses.en: it is sown in dishonor, it is raised in glory; it is sown in weakness, it is raised in power;

verses.zh: 所种的是血气的身体，复活的是灵性的身体。若有血气的身体，也必有灵性的身体。
verses.en: it is sown a natural body, it is raised a spiritual body. If there is a natural body, there is also a spiritual body.

verses.zh: 经上也是这样记着说：首先的人亚当成了有灵的活人（灵或作血气）；末后的亚当成了叫人活的灵。
verses.en: So it is written: The first man Adam became a living being; the last Adam, a life-giving spirit.

verses.zh: 但属灵的不在先，属血气的在先，以后才有属灵的。
verses.en: The spiritual did not come first, but the natural, and after that the spiritual.

verses.zh: 头一个人是出于地，乃属土；第二个人是出于天。
verses.en: The first man was of the dust of the earth; the second man is of heaven.

verses.zh: 那属土的怎样，凡属土的也就怎样；属天的怎样，凡属天的也就怎样。
verses.en: As was the earthly man, so are those who are of the earth; and as is the heavenly man, so also are those who are of heaven.

verses.zh: 我们既有属土的形状，将来也必有属天的形状。
verses.en: And just as we have borne the image of the earthly man, so shall we bear the image of the heavenly man.

verses.zh: 弟兄们，我告诉你们说，血肉之体不能承受神的国，必朽坏的不能承受不朽坏的。
verses.en: I declare to you, brothers and sisters, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God, nor does the perishable inherit the imperishable.

verses.zh: 我如今把一件奥秘的事告诉你们：我们不是都要睡觉，乃是都要改变，
verses.en: Listen, I tell you a mystery: We will not all sleep, but we will all be changed—

verses.zh: 就在一霎时，眨眼之间，号筒末次吹响的时候。因号筒要响，死人要复活，成为不朽坏的，我们也要改变。
verses.en: in a flash, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet. For the trumpet will sound, the dead will be raised imperishable, and we will be changed.

verses.zh: 这必朽坏的，总要变成不朽坏的；这必死的，总要变成不死的。
verses.en: For the perishable must clothe itself with the imperishable, and the mortal with immortality.

verses.zh: 这必朽坏的既变成不朽坏的，这必死的既变成不死的，那时经上所记死被得胜吞灭的话就应验了。
verses.en: When the perishable has been clothed with the imperishable, and the mortal with immortality, then the saying that is written will come true: Death has been swallowed up in victory.

verses.zh: 死啊！你得胜的权势在哪里？死啊！你的毒钩在哪里？
verses.en: Where, O death, is your victory? Where, O death, is your sting?

verses.zh: 死的毒钩就是罪，罪的权势就是律法。
verses.en: The sting of death is sin, and the power of sin is the law.

verses.zh: 感谢神，使我们藉着我们的主耶稣基督得胜。
verses.en: But thanks be to God! He gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.zh: 所以，我亲爱的弟兄们，你们务要坚固，不可摇动，常常竭力多作主工；因为知道，你们的劳苦在主里面不是徒然的。
verses.en: Therefore, my dear brothers and sisters, stand firm. Let nothing move you. Always give yourselves fully to the work of the Lord, because you know that your labor in the Lord is not in vain.

verses.zh: 论到为圣徒捐钱，我从前怎样吩咐加拉太的众教会，你们也当怎样行。
verses.en: Now about the collection for the Lord’s people: Do what I told the Galatian churches to do.

verses.zh: 每逢七日的第一日，各人要照自己的进项抽出来留着，免得我来的时候现凑。
verses.en: On the first day of every week, each one of you should set aside a sum of money in keeping with your income, saving it up, so that when I come no collections will have to be made.

verses.zh: 及至我来到，你们再打发人拿着你们的捐资去耶路撒冷。
verses.en: Then, when I arrive, I will give letters of introduction to the men you approve and send them with your gift to Jerusalem.

verses.zh: 若我也该去，他们可以和我同去。
verses.en: If it seems advisable for me to go also, they will accompany me.

verses.zh: 我要从马其顿经过；既经过了，就要到你们那里去，
verses.en: After I go through Macedonia, I will come to you—for I will be going through Macedonia.

verses.zh: 或者和你们同住几时，就是冬天也行，叫你们可以送我到我要去的地方。
verses.en: Perhaps I will stay with you for a while, or even spend the winter, so that you can help me on my journey, wherever I go.

verses.zh: 我如今不愿意路过见你们；主若许我，我指望在你们那里多住几时。
verses.en: For I do not want to see you now and make only a passing visit; I hope to spend some time with you, if the Lord permits.

verses.zh: 但我要仍旧住在以弗所，直等到五旬节。
verses.en: But I will stay on at Ephesus until Pentecost,

verses.zh: 因为有宽大又有功效的门为我开了，并且反对的人也多。
verses.en: because a great door for effective work has opened to me, and there are many who oppose me.

verses.zh: 若是提摩太来到，你们要留心，叫他在你们那里无所惧怕，因为他劳力作主的工，像我一样。
verses.en: When Timothy comes, see to it that he has nothing to fear while he is with you, for he is carrying on the work of the Lord, just as I am.

verses.zh: 所以无论谁，都不可藐视他，只要送他平安前行，叫他到我这里来，因我正等候他与众弟兄同来。
verses.en: No one, then, should treat him with contempt. Send him on his way in peace so that he may come to me. I am expecting him along with the brothers.

verses.zh: 至于兄弟亚波罗，我再三地劝他，要同众弟兄到你们那里去；但这时他决不愿意去，几时有了机会他必去。
verses.en: Now about our brother Apollos: I strongly urged him to go to you with the brothers. He was quite unwilling to go now, but he will go when he has the opportunity.

verses.zh: 你们务要儆醒，在真道上站立得稳，要作大丈夫，要刚强。
verses.en: Be on your guard; stand firm in the faith; be courageous; be strong.

verses.zh: 凡事要凭爱心而行。
verses.en: Do everything in love.

verses.zh: 弟兄们，你们晓得司提反一家，是亚该亚初结的果子，并且他们专以服侍圣徒为念。
verses.en: You know that the household of Stephanas were the first converts in Achaia, and they have devoted themselves to the service of the Lord’s people. I urge you, brothers and sisters,

verses.zh: 我劝你们顺服这样的人，并一切同工同劳的人。
verses.en: to submit to such people and to everyone who joins in the work and labors at it.

verses.zh: 司提反和福徒拿都并亚该古到这里来，我很喜欢，因为你们待我有不及之处，他们补上了。
verses.en: I was glad when Stephanas, Fortunatus and Achaicus arrived, because they have supplied what was lacking from you.

verses.zh: 他们既安慰了我的心，也安慰了你们的心。这样的人，你们务要敬重。
verses.en: For they refreshed my spirit and yours also. Such men deserve recognition.

verses.zh: 亚西亚的众教会问你们安。亚居拉和百基拉并在他们家里的教会，因主多多地问你们安。
verses.en: The churches in the province of Asia send you greetings. Aquila and Priscilla greet you warmly in the Lord, and so does the church that meets at their house.

verses.zh: 众弟兄都问你们安。你们要用圣洁的亲嘴彼此问安。
verses.en: All the brothers and sisters here send you greetings. Greet one another with a holy kiss.

verses.zh: 我保罗亲笔问安。
verses.en: I, Paul, write this greeting in my own hand.

verses.zh: 若有人不爱主，这人可咒诅。主必要来！
verses.en: If anyone does not love the Lord, let that person be cursed! Come, Lord!

verses.zh: 愿主耶稣基督的恩惠，常与你们同在！
verses.en: The grace of the Lord Jesus be with you.

verses.zh: 我的爱在基督耶稣里，常与你们众人同在。阿们！
verses.en: My love to all of you in Christ Jesus. Amen.
